p: The pronounced larvicidal activity of P. mekongensis (Ngoc Linh) against Ae. aegypti can be attributed to the high concentration of α-pinene. This monoterpene has shown larvicidal activity against Ae. aegypti with LC 50 values ranging from 15.4 μg/mL to 79.1 μg/mL [ 56]. Interestingly, the larvicidal activity of P. mekongensis (Ngoc Linh) against Cx. quinquefasciatus was less (24-h LC 50 = 42.7 μg/mL), consistent with the reduced activity of α-pinene against this mosquito larva (LC 50 = 95 μg/mL) [ 57].
